citation.article-title: Collimonas fungivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a chitinolytic soil bacterium with the ability to grow on living fungal hyphae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Collimonas fungivorans sp. nov.
Collimonas fungivorans (fun.gi.vo′rans. L. n. fungus mould, mushroom, fungus; L. part. adj. vorans devouring, eating; N.L. part. adj. fungivorans fungus-eating).
General characteristics are the same as given above for the genus.
On 0·1× TSB agar (3 days, 20 °C), the type strain forms flat, glossy, turbid, whitish colonies of 3–7 mm diameter with a layered structure (colony type I; see Results and Discussion).
The substrate-use profile of the type strain is given above.
The G+C content of the type strain is 57·8 mol%.
Reference strains are Ter166, Ter300 and Ter330.
